data.title: LOUIS, DUKE OF BURGUNDY French son of Louis de France
data.meta_description: Prints of LOUIS, DUKE OF BURGUNDY French son of Louis de France and later Grand-Dauphin to Louis XIV (his Grandfather)
data.text:
Mary Evans Picture Library Photo Prints and Wall Art

Louis, Duke of Burgundy

LOUIS, DUKE OF BURGUNDY - French son of Louis de France and later Grand-Dauphin to Louis XIV (his Grandfather) Date: 1682 - 1712. Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries. © Mary Evans Picture Library

Media ID 14274728

1682 1712 Burgundy Dauphin Grandfather

Framed Prints

Bring historic elegance to your home or office with our exquisite Framed Prints featuring the portrait of Louis, Duke of Burgundy. This striking image, taken from Mary Evans Prints Online, captures the regal grace and sophistication of the French nobleman, who served as Grand-Dauphin to his grandfather, Louis XIV. Add a touch of timeless charm and rich history to your space with this beautifully presented Framed Print. Each print is meticulously crafted with high-quality materials and attention to detail, ensuring a stunning addition to any décor. Order yours today and relive the grandeur of the past.

Photo Prints

Experience the regal elegance of the past with our Media Storehouse range of Photographic Prints featuring "Louis, Duke of Burgundy" by Rights Managed from Mary Evans Prints Online. This stunning image captures the essence of the French nobleman, son of Louis de France and later Grand-Dauphin to Louis XIV, in the year 1682. With intricate detail and vivid colors, this photographic print brings history to life, making it a perfect addition to any home or office decor. Immerse yourself in the rich history of the 17th century and add a touch of royalty to your space with this exquisite print.

Poster Prints

Bring history to life with our exquisite Media Storehouse Poster Prints featuring the captivating image of Louis, Duke of Burgundy. This stunning portrait, dating back to 1682, showcases the French nobleman in his grandeur as the Grand-Dauphin to his grandfather, King Louis XIV. With its rich detail and vibrant colors, this high-quality print is a must-have for history enthusiasts, art collectors, or anyone looking to add a touch of elegance and sophistication to their home or office. Order now and bring a piece of the past into your present.

Jigsaw Puzzles

Discover the rich history of the French monarchy with our captivating jigsaw puzzle from Media Storehouse. Featuring the portrait of Louis, Duke of Burgundy, this intricately detailed puzzle brings to life the elegance and grandeur of the 17th century. Originally painted by an unknown artist in 1682, this portrait showcases Louis as the French son of Louis de France and later Grand-Dauphin to Louis XIV. Add this beautiful puzzle to your collection and immerse yourself in the stories of the past. Perfect for puzzle enthusiasts and history buffs alike." - Media Storehouse. [Image Description: A portrait of Louis, Duke of Burgundy, dressed in ornate clothing and holding a scepter, with a regal expression on his face. The painting is set against a dark background, with intricate details in the fabric, jewels, and the duke's hair.]
